title: Variables in C
subject: C Programming
theory:
Container to store data. 
Named memory location. 
Must be declared before use. 
Type VariableName = Value;

examples.code:
int a; // Declared
a = 10; // Assigned
int b = 20; // Init

interview_questions.question: Difference between Declaration and Definition?
interview_questions.answer: Declaration tells compiler about existence. Definition allocates memory.
